alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:37PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Letcher, east central Leslie, southeastern Perry, southeastern Knott, southeastern Floyd and Pike Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1037 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Coal Run Village to Ivan to near Slemp. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Hall, Greenleaf, Zebulon, Dry Creek, Coal Run, Deane, Democrat and Topmost around 1040 PM EDT. Wheelwright, Fleming-Neon, Speight, Halo, Raccoon, Melvin, McRoberts, Burton, Ehkhorn Mine and Hemphill around 1045 PM EDT. Blackey, Skyline, Elko, Kimper, Defeated Creek, Beefhide, Carcassonne, Gander, Ligon and Buckhorn Hollow around 1050 PM EDT. Letcher, Roxana, Jonancy, Myra, Premium, Dorton, Hot Spot, Virgie, Indian Bottom and David around 1055 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Trailer, Ice, Oscaloosa, Whitco, Mcandrews, Crown, Van, Day, Tillie, Isom, Whitesburg, Lookout, Ermine, Phelps, Board Tree, Marlowe, Rockhouse, Colly, Bellcraft, Dongola, Mayking, Majestic, Sergent, Belcher, Wright, Winters, Thornton, Jamboree, Millstone, Farraday, Jenkins, Elkhorn City, Cedarville, Woodman, Payne Gap, Fishpond Lake, Tolliver Town, Neon Junction, Potters Fork and Haymond. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 8. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 2. U.S. Highway 23 in Lethcher County between mile markers 1 and 7. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 0 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Floyd; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike
